name: Microvania (KeyDrop, Gamekrazzy, OneThatEatYou, fatcatmilo)
description:
Computing and Robotics just got better - it's Microvania Robo ©, the gnarliest new consumer grade repair and maintanence robot from Keydrop Corporation!

Does your robot know how to freeze water?

Can your robot reverse the force of gravity?

Can your robot automatically reset your Keydrop Microvania Pro microcomputer when it malfunctions?

And that's not all.

Can your robot swim to a depth of 50m (ISO 5999) (upgrade sold seperately)?

You do that and more with the Microvania Robo © platform from Keydrop.

Controls

Controlling Microvania Robo is simple. With your Keydrop Easy-Use Keyboard by your side, you can move your robot with the wasd keys.

Do you need to cool your drinks on a hot summer's day, or need a cheap and simple way to cool your weapons grade plutonium reactor? Just use the Keydrop corp Freeze extension (sold seperately) using the j key.

Have the Keydrop world-famous Gravity extension (sold seperately)? Can't quite reach the spider on the ceiling that's threatening to eat your loved ones? Simply use the k key to activate.

Finally, in the unlikely even that your Keydrop corp Microvania Robo © unit is malfunctioning, or you want to see the upgrades you have collected so far, simply press the enter key to pause. It couldn't be simpler!

We hope you enjoy your new Keydrop product. Guaranteed to continue running in a thousand years or your money back!

Testimonials

If you're not convinced by Keydrop Microvania yet then just hear these testimonials from our happy customers!

I got the Microvania 

Paul Anderson, Albany NY

At first I was confused - my little Robo seemed to lose it's ability modules when I moved between sectors. Then I realised that was part of the fun - every time I go from one sector to the next I need to hunt around for the official Microvania © ability extension disk in that sector. What joy! Thanks Keydrop. 

Karen Karendottir, Reykjavik, Iceland

Amazing how confident they are in the durability of these robots - astounding to think that they could still be waking up and repairing things long after humanity is gone!

Phil Powers, Tranquility Base
